Brenna rated it it was amazing
Dec 22, 2007
Feb 02, 2008 Megan rated it really liked it
I've read this book at least 12 times over the last 17 years and it never gets old. It's charming and fun and clever with just a little bit of suspense and a few people you want to kick (every story needs a good villain and unrelated baddies). I read the illustrated version this year, and it's GORGEOUS! I'd happily put every watercolor on my wall if that were an option. A nifty bonus is that the illustrated version has the anglicized text -- "realise" and "savour" and "Hallowe'en" and such. It's I've read this book at least 12 times over the last 17 years and it never gets old. It's charming and fun and clever with just a little bit of suspense and a few people you want to kick (every story needs a good villain and unrelated baddies). I read the illustrated version this year, and it's GORGEOUS! I'd happily put every watercolor on my wall if that were an option. A nifty bonus is that the illustrated version has the anglicized text -- "realise" and "savour" and "Hallowe'en" and such. It's a nice touch! Looking forward to reading it on Harry's birthday (July 31) again next year. ...more

May 15, 2008 Ashley Hart rated it really liked it
Shelves: reread, 2020, 2020-monthly-motif
The edition featuring illustrations by Jim Kay is a must-have for any Harry Potter fan! The illustrations are so lovely, they really breath new life into this old favorite. With a fresh reread, I can easily see how this is the weakest story in the series, which is no surprise given that its JKs first book and the incredible amount of world-building involved. Sure, the writing can be superfluous at times, and Im still side-eyeing that rushed ending, with what is arguably the most climatic moment The edition featuring illustrations by Jim Kay is a must-have for any Harry Potter fan! The illustrations are so lovely, they really breath new life into this old favorite. With a fresh reread, I can easily see how this is the weakest story in the series, which is no surprise given that it’s JK’s first book and the incredible amount of world-building involved. Sure, the writing can be superfluous at times, and I’m still side-eyeing that rushed ending, with what is arguably the most climatic moment of the story happening off-screen (or off-page, if you will), but there is no denying the charm and, well, magic that the story delivers. ...more

Jul 12, 2010 Erin rated it it was amazing
Shelves: all-time-faves, ya, movie, 2018, audiobook, read-more-than-once, read-aloud-with-n, 2020
2/22/20. I dont think my progress update saved on my most recent reading of this book, so since Ive never written a review of it, now is as good a time as any.

Ive read this book so many times, and it never gets old. Read the original quite a few times, have listened to the audiobook (FANTASTIC), and now read the new illustrated version to my 6 year old while introducing him to the books for the first time. This version is beautiful, (albeit heavy) and Im so glad we purchased it.

Sharing these 2/22/20. I don’t think my progress update saved on my most recent reading of this book, so since I’ve never written a review of it, now is as good a time as any.

I’ve read this book so many times, and it never gets old. Read the original quite a few times, have listened to the audiobook (FANTASTIC), and now read the new illustrated version to my 6 year old while introducing him to the books for the first time. This version is beautiful, (albeit heavy) and I’m so glad we purchased it.

Sharing these books with my kiddo and introducing Harry Potter for the first time is a moment I’ve waited for since he was born, and it didn’t disappoint. So much commentary from him throughout. Gasps, eyes hidden in suspense, “WHAT?!?!”, “Noo!!!”, “GRYFFINDOR!!!”, and many chuckles. We finished it last night, and he’s officially hooked. Even if I don’t always feel like I’m doing a great job as a parent, well...at least I’m raising him to love Harry Potter. ...more
